common_issues.title: PiecesOS Long Term Memory High Resource Usage
common_issues.description: Users report high CPU and RAM usage with PiecesOS Long Term Memory, especially with chat apps and browsers.  The issue persists across updates, though some improvements were seen in version 11.1.0.  Suggested workarounds include disabling LTM, closing browser tabs, and restarting PiecesOS.  The Pieces team is actively investigating and working on optimization.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** High CPU usage with Long Term Memory (LTM) engine in PiecesOS

**Key Points:**

* High CPU usage reported by @epikkoder and @KnifMelti, particularly with Microsoft Edge and Discord.
* Issue appears to be related to the LTM engine and WebView2.
* High CPU usage continues after hotfixes and patches.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Initial hotfix released on March 5th.
* Additional patch released on March 6th.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue appears to be partially resolved, with reduced CPU usage for some users.
* However, high CPU usage persists for others, particularly with increased browser tab usage.
* Further investigation and development needed to fully address the issue.

**Next Steps:**

* @mark-at-pieces to investigate further based on detailed reports provided.
* Users to continue reporting their experiences and providing specific details about their setups.

**Additional Notes:**

* @cbchow reported similar CPU usage spikes.
* @KnifMelti observed a potential correlation between high CPU usage and the number of browser tabs open.

**Overall, the issue of high CPU usage with the LTM engine remains unresolved for some users.**

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* High RAM and CPU usage reported by users
* Some users experiencing memory leaks and significant performance impact
* Concerns about the functionality of Live Context and the "Optimize Memory" feature

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS consumes a large amount of memory and CPU resources, even when not actively being used.
* The issue seems widespread across various operating systems and hardware configurations.
* High resource usage impacts overall system performance and user experience.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team identified and replaced two heavy database technologies in version 11.1.0 to address memory and CPU issues.
* An "Optimize Memory" feature was implemented to unload unused ML models and free up RAM.
* The team is actively working on additional fixes to improve resource usage.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Version 11.1.0 has shown a significant improvement for some users, with reduced CPU and memory usage.
* However, some users are still experiencing high resource usage, even after the LTM-2 update.
* The Pieces team continues to investigate the issue and work on further solutions.

## Additional Notes:

* The high resource usage could be related to the functionality of Live Context and its underlying technology.
* Some users suggest a "lite" mode with fewer features could be beneficial for those who prioritize resource efficiency over advanced functionality.

## Overall, the conversation highlights the ongoing challenge of balancing performance and functionality in resource-intensive applications like Pieces OS. The Pieces team is actively working on improvements, and their efforts are showing positive results for some users. However, further optimization is needed to ensure a smooth and efficient experience for all.

* Error related to GetIt flutter package not finding a dependency
* Possibly heavy data migration
* No notification about a health check on the user's desktop

* Sharing log files with Pieces support team

related_issues.text:
Trojan Attack Updating Pieces OS to 11.2.1 Version
### Checked for Existing Issues?

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Today I got the notification from Pieces Software to update new version 11.2.1 I downloaded, and I tried to Install the application my antivirus terminated the process to install, and I got the report please ensure at your end.

`Event: Process terminated
Application: Setup/Uninstall
User: HARIPRASATH\Hari Prasath
User type: Initiator
Component: System Watcher
Result description: Terminated
Type: Trojan
Name: PDM:Trojan.Win32.Generic
Threat level: High
Object type: Process
Object path: C:\CondaTemp\Update-cb1fe563-b25b-4892-a950-60d71f0eed64
Object name: out-windows.exe
MD5: D40CB08BE832B0EFCFB23BE85D893AAF`
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: PiecesOS Antivirus Detection

**Key Points Raised:**

* PiecesOS triggers antivirus detection due to its monitoring of system activity for LTM-2 functionality.
* This is a common reaction from antivirus software, not a vulnerability in PiecesOS.

**Problems Identified:**

* Antivirus software identifies PiecesOS as malicious and terminates the process.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Report the antivirus detection as a false positive and add an exception for PiecesOS in antivirus settings.
* Review PiecesOS documentation on how it handles information captured for LTM-2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User confirmed they will contact antivirus support and review documentation.

**Additional Notes:**

* User expressed appreciation for the confirmation that there is no vulnerability in PiecesOS.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points**:
* The issue is related to Pieces OS failing to install and use Ollama because the Pieces environment lacks certain dependencies like curl.
* The problem appears to be caused by Pieces being installed as a snap package with limited sandbox access.

**Problems**:
* Pieces attempts to use `curl` which isn't available in the sandboxed environment.
* Manually installing Ollama doesn't affect Pieces installation due to the sandbox limitations.
* The latest Pieces snap versions haven't fixed this issue.
* User concerns exist about data privacy when using cloud-based LLMs.

**Solutions**:
* Proposed patching to fix Ollama usage within the sandbox environment.
* Infrastructure and dependency-related fixes are underway.

**Current Status**:
* Issue persists on latest snapshot versions.
* Fixes are ongoing and scheduled for next week.

**Additional Notes**:
* Users are actively inquiring about the fix progress.

**Outcome**:
* The resolution is still pending, although active development to address the issue is underway.

I tried using local modal (LLaMa 3.2 3B) which is relatively small size for fast response but it is stuck on thinking phase. This model is working on ollama but not on pieces desktop with local processing mode.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a3242cf3-831f-45ce-a1a2-222c73cb703d)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* AkhilTrivediX reported an error while using Pieces in Local-only mode.
* The error occured when attempting to use a Cloud-based LLM.

**Problems Identified:**

* Local-only mode prevents sending data to the cloud for security reasons.
* The error message did not clearly引导用户 to selecting local LLMs.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mack-at-pieces suggested downloading and using a local LLM.
* They included instructions on how to select local LLMs within the Pieces interface.
* They will modify the error message to provide a clearer path to selecting local LLMs.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved by selecting a local LLM.
* The error message will be modified for improved clarity.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate team member.
* Related issues and helpful resources were provided for reference.
* The author was encouraged to experiment with different LLMs to find the best fit.

recommendations: **Prioritize LTM Engine Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the ongoing issues related to the Long Term Memory (LTM) engine, particularly high CPU usage and performance problems.

**Improve Ollama Integration:** Address the difficulties users face when installing and using Ollama, focusing on dependency conflicts, error messages, and compatibility with different processing modes.

**Enhance UI/Functionality of Pieces OS and Desktop App:** Investigate and resolve reported UI and functionality conflicts, such as those affecting SQL Server Object Explorer and causing gray spaces in settings.

**Address PiecesOS Update and Launch Issues:** Provide clear and concise troubleshooting steps for users experiencing difficulties updating and launching PiecesOS, including solutions for antivirus conflicts and installation errors.
**Proactive Communication:**  Keep users informed about the status of known issues, particularly those related to LTM and Ollama, through release notes, blog posts, or in-app notifications.
**Improve Error Messages:** Review and revise error messages to make them more informative and user-friendly, guiding users towards appropriate solutions.
